intro: Bondtia freelingii, commonly known as the Freeling's bondtia, is a rare and distinctive member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features striking, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and vibrant green coloration. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically display a combination of red and yellow hues, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bondtia freelingii is considered a species of conservation concern.
